data.name: IntraTag
data.detailed_description:
In IntraTag you are catching other players. There are however not two, but three teams in this first-person game.

Three intransitive teams

One of the teams you should catch and one is looking for you. Each time you catch someone you gain two points and the other player loses a point. Whoever has most points at the end wins the round. A round ends either when the time is up or when one of the three teams has been eliminated.
Caught players do not leave the game though, but simply join the team of their catcher.

A new maze every round

The game is played in a randomly generated maze, so you'll never know what's around the next corner. Additionally, it is completely black in the maze and the only light sources are the adjustable torches (flash lights) which each player carries. Using it exposes your location to other players, but without it you won't be able to tell friend and foe apart.

However, the other players can also hear your steps, the faster you move, the louder you are.

Are you going to run around, torch blazing? Or are you going to hide in the shadows and ambush players? The choice is yours in IntraTag.

Lore and background

In a not too far future, humanity has started colonising the solar system. The third planet to have a permanent settlement was Mercury. Thanks to the eternal darkness, several polar craters have a moderate temperature year round, unlike the rest of the planet. Thus, they were ideal places to establish underground cities.

The possibilities for physical entertainment are rather limited in confined corridors of these bases, however one sport that developed there was intransitive tag (or intratag for short), which is played with three teams.

data.short_description: In a completely dark maze, three teams are hunting each other intransitively (think rock, paper, scissors). The only light in this first-person game comes from the adjustable torch each player is carrying. Using it exposes your location, but without it you won't be able to tell friend and foe apart.
